page.title: 09SCHOOLS IN EASTFIELD
page.content: There are six schools in the Eastfield and Cayton area, five primary and one secondary, Pindar school, named after a local dignitary, George Pindar. This takes children from 11 to 16. The others, Braeburn infant, Braeburn junior, Cayton, Overdale and St. George's R.C. cater for children from 5 to 11. There is also a nursery unit at Braeburn infants for pre_school children. A school day lasts from about 9 a.m. to 3.30 p.m. with an hour for lunch. A good proportion of children stay for school meals while the rest either bring sandwiches or go home. There is a wide curriculum ranging from maths and English to environmental studies, music, art and physical education. Most schools also have after school activities such as football, netball, recorder lessons and computer clubs.
